p: Genistein is an isoflavone isolated from soy. It possesses strong phytoestrogenic effects and both in vivo and in vitro studies have reported its efficiency for the management of endometriosis [ 4]. This molecule was reported to decrease the surface of the endometriotic implants and the histopathologic score through anti-angiogenic and anti-proliferative mechanisms [ 98]. Genistein exerts its anti-angiogenic effects by reducing the activity of PTK and MAPK, and by inhibiting HIF-1 and VEGF gene expression [ 99].
